article.description: St. Bonaventure holds on to beat Wagner 70-67
article.headline: St. Bonaventure holds on to beat Wagner 70-67
article.linkText: St. Bonaventure holds on to beat Wagner 70-67
article.story: ESTERO, Fla. -- Matthew Wright scored 19 points and added six assists as St. Bonaventure withstood a furious Wagner comeback to win 70-67 in the semifinal of the Gulf Coast Classic Tuesday night. St. Bonaventure (5-1) shot a blistering 65.4 percent in the first half on their way to a 43-31 halftime lead. Wright led the way, scoring 17 on 5-of-6 shooting in the half. The Bonnies couldn't sustain the pace and Wagner (4-3) erased the deficit. Marcus Burton's 3-pointer cut the lead to 59-58 with just under 8 minutes to play. St. Bonaventure responded with a 5-0 run that Wagner couldn't overtake. Jay Harris and Latif Rivers both missed 3-pointers that could have tied the game in the final 10 seconds. Mario Moody led Wagner with 19 points, tying a career high. Harris finished with 14.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
